subThemes.subtitle: Encipher
subThemes.description: In this exercise, you will have to encipher the poem A Fairy Song by William Shakespeare with Caesar cipher technique. To encrypt, you will use a key of 15.

exercise.text:
Over hill, over dale,
Thorough bush, thorough brier,
Over park, over pale,
Thorough flood, thorough fire!
I do wander everywhere,
Swifter than the moon's sphere;
And I serve the Fairy Queen,
To dew her orbs upon the green;
The cowslips tall her pensioners be;
In their gold coats spots you see;
Those be rubies, fairy favours;
In those freckles live their savours;
I must go seek some dewdrops here,
And hang a pearl in every cowslip's ear.

subThemes.subtitle: Encipher
subThemes.description:
In this exercise, you will have to encipher the poem On My First Son by Ben Jonson with Vigenère cipher technique.
To encrypt, you will use the key "VIGENERECIPHER".

exercise.text:
Farewell, thou child of my right hand, and joy;
My sin was too much hope of thee, loved boy.
Seven years thou wert lent to me, and I thee pay,
Exacted by thy fate, on the just day.

Oh, could I lose all father now! For why
Will man lament the state he should envy?
To have so soon 'scaped world's and flesh's rage,
And if no other misery, yet age!

Rest in soft peace, and asked, say, Here doth lie
Ben Jonson his best piece of poetry.
For whose sake henceforth all his vows be such
As what he loves may never like too much.

subThemes.subtitle: SQL injection
subThemes.description: In this exercise you have to connect to the service using a SQL injection

subThemes.subtitle: XSS
subThemes.description:
In this exercise, you have to retrive a cookie which have been add to the admin page.
A cookie is some data that are stock on the web browser by the web page to transfer data to an other page.
For example when you connect an account in any site, a login cookie is created. So when the web app needs to verify if your are connected, it sends the login cookie to the server which verify it.
To get your cookies, you can use document.cookie syntax.
